transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Thank you for calling TelcoMax customer support. This is Sarah. How can I help you today?

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Hi Sarah. I just got my bill and I'm really confused. It's way higher than it usually is.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I'm sorry to hear that. I'd be happy to help you figure out what's going on. Can I have your account number or the phone number on the account?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Perfect, thank you. Let me pull up your account... Okay, I have you here, John Smith. I can see your account. Let me look at your current bill.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Yeah, I usually pay around 90 dollars but this month it's over 150! I didn't change anything with my plan or add any services.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I understand your concern. Let me check the charges breakdown on your current bill... Okay, I can see your bill is $156.43 this month.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Right! What happened? That's like $65 more than normal.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Let me look at the details... I see the issue. You have $67.44 in international roaming charges on this bill. Did you travel outside the United States recently?

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Oh! Yes, I went to Canada for a few days earlier this month. I didn't know there would be roaming charges though. I thought Canada was included.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I can understand the confusion. Your current plan, the Unlimited Plus, does include coverage in the US, but international roaming, including Canada, is not included and charges do apply.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Oh man, I had no idea. So what exactly am I being charged for?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Let me break it down for you. During your trip from May 8th to May 12th, you used 2.3 gigabytes of data, made 47 minutes of calls, and sent 23 text messages while in Canada. The total for those charges is $67.44.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Wow, that's expensive! I was only there for a work conference. Is there anything that can be done about this?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I completely understand your frustration, especially since you weren't aware of the charges. Let me see what I can do for you as a valued customer.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: I appreciate that. I've been with you guys for over three years.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I can see that, and we really appreciate your loyalty. Here's what I can do - I can apply a one-time courtesy credit of 50% of those roaming charges, which would be $33.72. That would bring your bill down to $122.71.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Oh, that would be really helpful! Thank you so much.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: You're very welcome! I'm applying that credit to your account right now... Done. Your new bill total is $122.71.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Great, thank you. Is there a way to avoid this in the future if I travel again?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Absolutely! For future trips, we have a TravelPass option that's $10 per day when you're traveling in Canada or Mexico. It gives you unlimited talk, text, and use of your plan's data allowance while you're there.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: That's much better! How do I add that?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: The great thing is you don't need to add it in advance. It automatically activates when you use your phone in a TravelPass country, and you're only charged for the days you actually use it.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Oh perfect! So if I had had that, my five-day trip would have cost me $50 instead of $67?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Exactly right! And you would have had access to all your normal plan features without worrying about individual charges.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: That's really good to know. I travel to Canada a few times a year for work, so I'll definitely use that next time.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Perfect! Is there anything else I can help you with today, John?

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: No, that's everything. Thank you so much for your help and for that credit. I really appreciate it.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: You're very welcome! I've added notes to your account about the TravelPass option for your future reference. Your new bill of $122.71 is due on May 30th.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Perfect. Thanks again, Sarah. Have a great day!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: You too, John! Thank you for being a TelcoMax customer. Goodbye!

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Bye!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Thank you for calling TelcoMax customer support. This is Sarah. How may I assist you today?

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Hi, yes, I have NO service right now! I've been without service for over three hours and I work from home. This is a major problem!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I'm so sorry you're experiencing this issue. I can definitely understand how frustrating that must be, especially when you're working from home. Let me pull up your account and see what's going on.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: My phone number is 555-876-4321. This is ridiculous - I pay over $100 a month for premium service!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I have your account pulled up now, Maria. I can see you're on our Unlimited Premium plan. Let me check the network status in your area. What zip code are you in?

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: 90069. West Hollywood. My phone just says No Service and has for hours now. I've tried restarting it multiple times.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Thank you for that information, and thank you for trying the restart - that's good troubleshooting. Let me check our network status for your area right now...

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I'm seeing the issue now. I'm very sorry, but we do have a confirmed tower outage in the West Hollywood area that's affecting service.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: An outage?! For THREE HOURS? Why wasn't I notified about this?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I completely understand your frustration. The outage started at 11:42 AM Pacific time. We should have sent out alerts to affected customers. Let me check if notifications were sent...

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: I didn't get anything! And I need my phone for work. I've missed calls from clients!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you. I can see the outage is due to a power failure at one of our tower sites in your area. Our field technicians are on-site working to resolve it right now.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Okay, but when will it be fixed? I have a client call in an hour!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: According to our latest update, the estimated restoration time is 4:00 PM Pacific time, which is about two hours from now. However, our teams are working as quickly as possible to restore service sooner.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Two more hours?! This is unacceptable. I'm paying for premium service!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I absolutely understand, Maria, and you're right to be frustrated. This is definitely not the level of service we want to provide our premium customers. Let me see what I can do to help with your immediate needs and to make this right.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: I mean, what can you even do? I have no service!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: First, for your immediate situation - do you have access to WiFi at your home?

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Yes, I have WiFi.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Great! If you have a Samsung Galaxy phone, which I can see you do - the S24 Ultra - you can enable WiFi calling. This will let you make and receive calls over your WiFi connection instead of the cellular network.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Oh! I didn't know I could do that. How do I turn that on?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: It's really easy. Go to your Settings, then Connections, then WiFi Calling, and toggle it on. Once you do that, you'll be able to make and receive calls using your WiFi.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Hold on, let me try that... Okay, Settings... Connections... WiFi Calling... Okay, I'm turning it on now.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Perfect! You should see it connect shortly. This will work for all your calls and texts while the tower is being repaired.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Okay, it says WiFi Calling at the top of my screen now. So this will work for my client calls?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Yes, exactly! Your clients will call your normal number and it will come through over WiFi. The call quality is usually excellent over WiFi.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Okay, well that's at least something. But I still lost three hours of service.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: You're absolutely right, and I want to make this right for you. I'm going to apply a credit to your account for the service disruption. I'm applying a $25 credit right now for the inconvenience.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Okay, I appreciate that. But why didn't I get notified about the outage?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: That's a great question. Let me check your notification preferences... I see you have text and email alerts enabled. There may have been a delay in our notification system. I'm going to escalate this as feedback to our network operations team.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: I should have been told right away. I would have turned on WiFi calling hours ago!

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: You're absolutely correct, and I apologize that didn't happen. I'm making a note on your account about this, and I'm also going to add an additional $10 credit for the delayed notification. Your total credit will be $35.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Alright. I mean, I'm still frustrated this happened, but at least you're trying to help.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I really appreciate your understanding, Maria. Is there anything else I can do for you right now? I want to make sure you're all set for your client call.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: No, I think I'm okay now with the WiFi calling. When exactly will I get service back?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: The estimated time is 4:00 PM, but I'll set up a notification to be sent to you as soon as service is restored in your area. You'll get both a text and an email.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Okay, good. And the $35 credit will show on my next bill?

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Yes, exactly. It's already applied to your account and will appear on your next billing statement. You'll see it as Service disruption credit - $35.00.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: Alright. Thank you for your help, Sarah. I'm still not happy about the outage, but you've been helpful.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: I completely understand, and thank you for giving me the opportunity to help. I've documented everything in your account. Is there anything else I can assist with?

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: No, that's all. Thanks again.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: You're welcome, Maria. Again, I apologize for the service disruption. We'll have you back up and running as soon as possible. Have a great rest of your day.

transcript.speaker: CUSTOMER
transcript.text: You too. Bye.

transcript.speaker: AGENT
transcript.text: Goodbye!
